meanings.definition: To change the texture of something.
meanings.sent1: I will retexture the wall to make it smoother.
meanings.sent2: She decided to retexture the ceiling to give it a new look.
meanings.sent3: The painter joked that he could retexture the floor to feel like a cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to retexture the atmosphere, making it more comfortable.
meanings.sent5: The artist used different strokes to retexture the canvas, creating a unique pattern.

meanings.definition: The act of altering the texture of something.
meanings.sent1: The retexture of the fabric made it softer to touch.
meanings.sent2: He admired the retexture of the sculpture, noticing the intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The retexture of the cake made it look like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: The retexture of the music transformed the mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The retexture of the landscape painting brought it to life, adding depth and dimension.
